name: docs-site

scripts.//dev: port 3008 for docs, to distinguish from deploying app
scripts.//build: delete .next to prevent netlify from caching and not updating sidebar when page titles change - thanks https://github.com/shuding/nextra/issues/1564#issuecomment-1688460307
scripts.//sort-sitemap1: sort lines 3 to n-1 of the sitemap (these are hardcoded where the url tags should be). command is based on the stackoverflow answer here https://stackoverflow.com/a/46018020/8409296
scripts.//sort-sitemap2: note: avoided using `ex` command for this because that apparently isn't on netlify's default toolchain for building nextjs projects
scripts.//sort-sitemap3: sitemap is sorted because for some reason after upgrading to nextra 4, order of pages seems to change after each build
scripts.sort-sitemap: { head -n 2 public/sitemap.xml; sed '1,2d;$d' public/sitemap.xml | sort; tail -n 1 public/sitemap.xml; } > public/sitemap.tmp && mv public/sitemap.tmp public/sitemap.xml
scripts.//postbuild: build sitemap (sorted) and pagefind index (for searching docs)
scripts.postbuild: next-sitemap && npm run sort-sitemap && pagefind --site .next/server/app --output-path public/_pagefind

/: dompurify should not be needed here, it's only used indirectly via nextra's mermaid rendering, but there is a dependency issue they need to fix, see https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid/issues/6078
